appDesc.message: Find a profitable product and start selling on Amazon quickly! Amazon product research made easy! See sales estimates and FBA fees.

extendTrialMessage.message: Get up to 2 month for free

resultsTooltip.message: The number of products shown on the current Amazon page.

avgSalesRankTooltip.message: “Average Sales Rank” refers to the average sales rank for any products shown on the current Amazon page.

avgMonthlySalesTooltip.message: “Average Monthly Sales” refers to the average number of sales each month for any products shown on the current Amazon page.

avgMonthlyRevenueTooltip.message: “Average Monthly Revenue” refers to the average revenue per month for any products shown on the current Amazon page.

nicheHistoryTooltip.message: This information includes the number of sales, rankings, and price data in the niche over different periods of time.

variantsTooltip.message: This refers to the number of product variants, which means the same product may come in another color, size, design, or configuration.

avgPriceTooltip.message: This refers to the average price for any products shown on the current Amazon page.

opScoreTooltip.message: This score is based on the niche’s profits, level of demand, and competition. The Niche Score is only available on the search page.

opScoreDisabled.message: Niche Score is available only on the search page

satScoreDisabled.message: Saturation Score is available only on the search page

avgMarginImpactTooltip.message: This refers to the average net margin for any products shown on the current Amazon page.

avgReviewsTooltip.message: This refers to the average reviews for any products shown on the current Amazon page.

rankTooltip.message: Known as “BSR” (Best-seller's Rank), and “Amazon Sales Rank”, this is a score that Amazon assigns to a specific product based on historical sales data.

bsr30Tooltip.message: The average product’s best-seller rank (BSR) for the past 30 days.

price30Tooltip.message: The average price for the past 30 days.

minPriceTooltip.message: The lowest price for the item, across all sellers.

netTooltip.message: The amount a seller makes after selling one item, and the Amazon FBA fee is deducted.

fbaFeesTooltip.message: The amount Amazon receives for handling one item, if it is sold through FBA.

lqsTooltip.message: The Listing Quality Score (LQS) indicates how good the listing is. Click on the value to see what factors contribute to this score.

categoryTooltip.message: Categories are used to organize product information and make it easier for customers to find what they're searching for.

extractOneProductOnly.message: Extract one Product only at Product Page

sellersTooltip.message: The number of people or businesses selling this product on Amazon.

estSalesTooltip.message: Estimated number of items sold in a month. This value is based on product rank.

reviewsTooltip.message: The number of reviews regarding the buyer's satisfaction with a particular product.

rprTooltip.message: This is the ratio of how much revenue a seller makes, per one review. A higher number means it’s relatively easy for a new seller to enter the niche.

availableFromTooltip.message: The date when the product first became available on Amazon.

ratingTooltip.message: The average score (ranges from one to five), is based on the total number of reviews that buyers submit for a product.

sellerTypeTooltip.message: There are three types of sellers on Amazon: Fulfillment by Amazon (FBA), Fulfillment by Merchant (FBM), and Amazon itself (AMZ).

oversizeTooltip.message: This label indicates if a product is oversized.

wrongPage.message:
It looks like you are not at Amazon page. We'll load an example page and open the AMZScout PRO for you.
Happy scouting.

Regards,
AMZScout team

pageLoading.message: Please wait for the page to load

cantGetProductsErr.message:
There is no product data on this page.

AMZScout PRO extension can only display data for Amazon pages with products. Try running the extension on a page that lists products, such as:
- Product search results page
- Product listing page
- Best Sellers, Today’s Deals and other product grouping pages

instanceUnsupportedErr.message: Your version of the AMZScout is no longer supported. Please, update the AMZScout to the latest one.

instanceBlockedErr.message: Your instance of the AMZScout is blocked. Please, contact with support.

unhandledErr.message: It looks like we are at the wrong page. Please try a different one.

paymentRejectedErr.message: Payment is rejected. Please check your payment details and try again.

trialEndedSub.message: Buy now and keep tracking competitors' sales

trialEndedAlert.message: You should purchase the AMZScout extension for further usage

signUpTitle.message:
Sign Up to Find Your
Profitable Product

signUpMessage1.message: No credit card required during trial

signUpMessage2.message: You'll get fully functional app after sign up

marginImpactTooltip.message: An item’s margins after paying FBA fees. This figure is shown as a percentage.

faq_q_0.message: Is the cost for the PRO Extension a one-time fee or is it monthly?

faq_a_0.message: You can purchase a monthly, annual, or lifetime subscription for the PRO Extension here. You will be charged monthly or annually, and the license will be extended. If you opt for a lifetime license, it will be a one-time fee only.

faq_q_1.message: I bought the PRO Extension, how do I use it?

faq_a_1.message: Check out the PRO Extension tutorial so you can enjoy a quick and productive start with your profitable product research! If you have any questions after that, our support will be happy to help, just email support@amzscout.net.

faq_q_2.message: Are the values in PRO Extension monthly, daily, or yearly estimates?

faq_a_2.message: Sales, revenue, and other parameters you see right away are estimated monthly values. You can see daily estimates on the product history diagram.

faq_q_3.message: How are the estimated values calculated?

faq_a_3.message: These values are calculated using the formula we developed, and is updated continuously to match Amazon closely. It relies on the ranking of the product in a category.

faq_q_4.message: What does the Net Margin column mean?

faq_a_4.message: This refers to the amount you’ll see from selling an item after Amazon’s FBA and referral fees.

faq_q_5.message: What does the LQS column mean?

faq_a_5.message: This stands for Listing Quality Score. AMZScout analyzes many product description aspects to evaluate the listing quality. The lower the average LQS in the niche, the easier it is to enter that market, since you can make a superior listing and stand out from the competition. To see more details, hover your cursor over the LQS value.

faq_q_6.message: What does the RPR column mean?

faq_a_6.message: RPR stands for Revenue Per Review. This metric reflects monthly revenue volume relative to the number of reviews a product has. A higher RPR means better selling opportunities on Amazon.

faq_q_7.message: Is the FBA fee calculated by piece or by volume?

faq_a_7.message: The FBA fee is calculated by piece, and is based on the shipping size and shipping weight on the product page. This amount indicates the fees for one month.

faq_q_8.message: What is the difference between the PRO Extension and the AMZScout desktop app?

faq_a_8.message: The PRO Extension focuses more on the niche evaluation, while the AMZScout desktop app helps you find an exact product, and then provides keywords to actually help you sell the product. Please check out the Amazon Seller's Bundle and for specific details about how each of our tools can be used.

faq_q_9.message: If I have another question or problem with AMZScout, how can I get support?

faq_a_9.message: The fastest way to get support is by emailing your question to support@amzscout.net.

totalFeeTooltip.message: The FBA Fee is calculated for each product as if it were sold using Amazon FBA

taxesVATTooltip.message: For products offered on Amazon and sent to destinations within the EU and Northern Ireland, product prices are inclusive of VAT, which varies by member countries.

monthlyStorageTooltip.message: Between October and December, keep in mind that storage fees are usually more expensive than during other times of the year. The FBA Calculator is showing fees for the current moment.

estimatedRevenueTooltip.message: Estimated monthly revenue based on Estimated Monthly Sales and Margin Impact

estimatedProfitTooltip.message: Estimated monthly profit based on Estimated Monthly Sales and Margin Impact

roiTooltip.message: Return on investment is a ratio between net profit and the initial investment. A high ROI means you can expect a large return, on top of the initial investment.

favoritesTooltip.message: Add to favorites to save these products, compare, and track them.  This will help you to choose the best one.

inventoryTooltip.message: The number of items in stock.

referralMessage.message: Share this link with your friends and you'll get 1 week more for free for every friend, who will sign up. Your friend will get additional 1 week for free too.

paymentRuble.message: On the next step you will see amount in Russian rubles, but in fact your payment will be charged in :country :currency. It will be :price::currency

orderProcessing.message: Your order will be processed in 5 minutes. Please, try to use the extension again after 5 minutes.

keywordsPropositionFind.message: Get thousands of keywords for this product, even the ones your competitors don’t know about!

keywordsPropositionReverse.message: Open Reverse ASIN Lookup to get more keywords

keywordsPropositionLearn.message: GO TO THE AMZSCOUT ASIN LOOKUP

maxImport.message: Maximum quantity for the import of ::count products

emptyImport.message: No products found, check your file

bestSellerTooltip.message: Bestseller (BS) shows if the item is a best-selling product on Amazon.

trialMessage.message:
For the next 7 days, you can use all the features of AMZScout Chrome Extension without any restrictions.

No credit card required. No surprises. Just results.

Here is some tips about AMZScout:
- Almost all table headers have useful tooltips. Hold the mouse on it a while and you'll see it.
- You can sort data by any column, just click on the table header.
- All values from the table with blue color are clickable, try to click them to see more oppotrunities.

Have a good scouting with AMZScout!

strictFilterTooltip.message: The search parameters you’ve used seem too strict. Try changing some of them, or turn off the filters.

t0.message:
Try to use AMZScout PRO at Stream or at Goldbox pages. There is tons of ideas for you! AMZScout PRO works almost with any Amazon pages.
Also we carefully will extract for you products from Movers and Shakers page and even from Most Wished For.

t1.message:
All the blue numbers and rows in the product spreadsheet are clickable.
Try to click them to check what each value means.

t2.message:
Titles of columns have pop-out hints, hover your cursor over a title for couple of seconds to see it.
You can click on any title and sort data in the spreadsheet by this indicator.
BTW, if you want to sort products by number appeared at page, click # sign at first column header.

t3.message: Add potential products to the favorites by clicking star on the left and check them whenever you want by clicking Favorites button at the bottom

t4.message: If you click on a value in FBA Fees or Net Price column, you will open Profit Calculator, that lets you enter the product cost to calculate profit and ROI.

t5.message: If you click a value in Rank column, you will see a graph of rank changes in time.

t6.message: If you move your cursor on arrow on the left and click, you will open a drop-down menu, that allows you to find a similar products on Alibaba, copy product's ASIN or get product keywords.

t7.message: Find keyword ideas to promote your product effectively just by clicking arrow on the left and choosing the needed action.

t8.message:
The product is best selling with rank 1 if it has an orange round sign in BSR column.
Find out in which category the product is selling best hovering the cursor over the sign.

t9.message:
The EBC column shows green check mark when the product has Enhanced Brand Content or A+ listing.
EBC is open to sellers who have been approved as brand owners through Amazon’s Brand Registry process.

t10.message: If you hover your cursor over LQS value for a couple of seconds, you will see more details about the quality of listing.

t11.message: If you click on a Price value, you will see the graph with price changes in time.

t12.message: If you click on the Niche Score number you will see a full breakdown of the niche potential.

os_open_on_run.message: Open this window at every run

os_productsCount_2_desc.message: You will compete with a high amount of sellers.

os_reviewsCount_2_desc.message: You need some reviews to get sales.

os_reviewsCount_3_desc.message: You can get sales with just a few reviews.

os_reviewsCount_4_desc.message: You can get sales with 0-2 reviews.

os_lqs_2_desc.message: It will take effort to create equal quality listing of the product.

os_lqs_3_desc.message: You can easily create a better listing of the product.

os_lqs_4_desc.message: You can easily create the best listing of the product.

os_amzSellers_2_desc.message: You will compete with some of Amazon products, which is hard.

os_amzSellers_3_desc.message: You will not compete with Amazon for sales much, which is good.

os_amzSellers_4_desc.message: You will not compete with Amazon for sales, which is good.

os_topBrands_1_desc.message: You will compete with several famous brands.

os_topBrands_2_desc.message: You will compete with famous brands.

os_topBrands_3_desc.message: You won’t compete with many famous brands.

os_topBrands_4_desc.message: You won’t compete with famous brands.

os_topSellers_2_desc.message: You will compete with a few strong sellers.

os_topSellers_3_desc.message: You won’t compete with many strong sellers.

os_topSellers_4_desc.message: You won’t compete with strong sellers.

os_avgRating_1_desc.message: It will be very hard to make a product with better quality.

os_avgRating_2_desc.message: You can try and make a product with better quality.

os_avgRating_3_desc.message: You can quite easily make a product with better quality.

os_avgRating_4_desc.message: You can easily make a product with better quality.

os_avgSales_1_desc.message: You will need to work hard to sell, even if you are on the first page.

os_avgSales_2_desc.message: You will need efforts to sell, even if you are on the first page.

os_avgSales_3_desc.message: You will have a chance to sell a lot, especially if you are on the first page.

os_avgSales_4_desc.message: You can sell a lot, especially if you are on the first page.

os_dateFirstAvailable_1_desc.message: You can be sure that the product has been on demand for years but there are some old sellers who will compete with you.

os_dateFirstAvailable_2_desc.message: You can be sure that the product has been on demand for awhile but there are some old sellers who will compete with you.

os_dateFirstAvailable_3_desc.message: The demand might be temporary but it has a chance to grow and you can be one of the first sellers.

os_dateFirstAvailable_4_desc.message: The demand might be temporary but it has a chance to grow and you will be one of the first sellers.

os_avgPrice_1_desc.message: Prices are outside the $$15-40 range. It's difficult to make profits if prices are low or sell in large quantities if prices are high.

os_avgPrice_2_desc.message: Some prices are not inside the $$15-40 range. It's difficult to make profits if prices are low or sell in large quantities if prices are high.

os_avgPrice_3_desc.message: Most prices are inside the $$15-40 range. It's easier to make profits if prices are not low or sell in large quantities if prices are not high.

os_avgPrice_4_desc.message: The prices are inside the $$15-40 range. It's easier to make profits if prices are not low or sell in large quantities if prices are not high.

os_avgMargin_1_desc.message: You will need to sell a lot to profit. Pay close attention to fba fees, shipping, production and marketing costs. They may be too high. Use the Profit Calculator to count them.

os_avgMargin_2_desc.message: You will need to sell a lot to profit. Pay close attention to fba fees, shipping, production and marketing costs. They are may be a bit high. Use the Profit Calculator to count them.

os_avgMargin_3_desc.message: You are set to profit. But don’t forget to add shipping, production and marketing to your costs in the Profit Calculator.

os_avgMargin_4_desc.message: You will easily profit. But don’t forget to add shipping, production and marketing to your costs in the Profit Calculator.

ps_margin_1.message: It is hard to make a profit with this product.

ps_margin_2.message: You will have enough profit with this product.

ps_margin_3.message: You will have a great margin with this product.

ps_rpr_1.message: You will need a lot of reviews to get some sales.

ps_rpr_2.message: You will need some reviews to get sales.

ps_rpr_3.message: You will be able to get decent sales even with a low review count.

ps_lqs_1.message: This listing is great, you will need to have the same quality listing to compete.

ps_lqs_2.message: This listing is average quality, you can try and make a better listing to compete.

ps_lqs_3.message: This listing is low quality, you can easily make a better listing to compete.

ps_revenue_1.message: This product doesn't earn much yet.

ps_revenue_2.message: There is a medium revenue opportunity.

ps_revenue_3.message: There is a big revenue opportunity.

ps_sellers_tooltip.message: You will need to verify the specifics about whether it is possible to resell this product - this assessment is based only on the fact that the product is being sold by several sellers on Amazon

ps_sellers_desc_1.message: A lot of sellers sell this product. If they can offer a better price and have good reviews on their account, they could have most of the sales of this product.

ps_sellers_desc_2.message: Quite a few sellers sell this product. With a good price they could get a lot of sales of this product. However, this number of sellers is a good sign as it means that the product is easy to source.

ps_sellers_desc_3.message: Only a few sellers sell this product. With a good price you could get a lot of sales. However, be aware that if so few sellers are on the listing, it could be hard to source this product.

ps_estsales_desc_1.message: Even if you win the buybox regularly, you will not have many sales with this product.

ps_estsales_desc_2.message: You will have a sufficient number of sales if you win the buybox regularly.

ps_estsales_desc_3.message: You will be able to have a high number of sales if you win the buybox regularly.

tooltip_1_beginner.message: See the Niche breakdown report here.

tooltip_2_beginner.message: Find products that fit your specific criteria. For example, select a price you want to sell for, monthly sales, etc.

tooltip_3_beginner.message: Choose columns you actually need, and you’ll get a customized view where unnecessary data is removed and doesn’t distract you.

tooltip_4_beginner.message: To sort by any column, click on its title.

tooltip_5_beginner.message: The revenue calculator is here. You can see revenue and expenses of a product, including FBA fees.

tooltip_6_beginner.message: Reviews are hard to get, that’s why it’s important to find a product with a high Revenue Per Review ratio. It means you’ll be able to make great revenue with few reviews, as a new seller.

tooltip_7_beginner.message: This is a Listing Quality Score with a detailed description of what is good and bad in the product page. Just hover your cursor over it. You’ll immediately see what you can do better, or copy what is done.

tooltip_8_beginner.message: This is a Niche Suggestion or Finder, intended to give you ideas for niches you can start with. This will help you to expand your horizons about what can be sold on Amazon.

tooltip_9_beginner.message: Product Score shows if a product is a great idea to sell based on its sales, rank, rating, reviews, and other indicators. It saves you a ton of work since you can just ignore products with a low score, and not research them in-depth.

tooltip_10_beginner.message: This shows the keywords frequently used in titles in the niche. How often they appear in titles is shown in brackets. Use the most popular words to create your own title, building on the work done by your competitors.

tooltip_1_expert.message: You can always find the Niche breakdown report here.

tooltip_2_expert.message: Set filters to match your own product criteria. This helps you select products at a certain sale price, certain demand, and so on, based on your selling strategy.

tooltip_3_expert.message: Customize the menu to suit your needs, by deciding which columns are visible.

tooltip_4_expert.message: To sort by columns, simply click the title. It will help you find the highest revenue product, or the newest one, etc. Looking at newer products can help you set expectations for sales on your first batches of inventory.

tooltip_5_expert.message: The revenue calculator helps you figure out your profit for selling an item. It takes into account Amazon fulfillment fees for FBA items, estimated storage fees, and advertisement costs. Input your costs to get a true profit estimate.

tooltip_6_expert.message: Reviews aren’t easy to get, so it’s better to find a product with a high Revenue Per Review ratio. A higher RPR ratio means it’s possible to make money, even with only a few reviews.

tooltip_7_expert.message: The Listing Quality Score helps you see weaknesses in competitor listings, based on lengths of descriptions and images. It’s a good baseline, but closer inspection will still be needed to recognize more specific flaws.

tooltip_8_expert.message: Niche Finder gives you niche ideas to inspire and help discover new product sections worthy to dig deeper into.

tooltip_9_expert.message: Product Score shows if a product is a great idea to sell, based on its sales, rank, rating, reviews, and other indicators. Lets you save on a ton of unnecessary research, by indicating unworthy products with a low score.

tooltip_10_expert.message: This shows the keywords frequently used in titles in the niche. How often they appear in titles is shown in brackets. Use the most popular words to create your own title, building on the work done by your competitors.

tutorial2Title.message: Learn how to quickly master AMZScout

tutorialStepMenuTitle1.message: 2. Learn how to find a niche idea

tutorialStepMenuTitle2.message: 3. Learn how to check your niche idea

tutorial1Step1Description.message: We have a handy indicator called Product Score which ranges products by its potential profitability.

tutorial1Step1Actions.message: Start by clicking on the top of the Product Score column to put all the products in order from highest to lowest.

tutorial1Step2Description.message: Now that we have found interesting products, lets get some niches it belongs to.

tutorial1Step2Actions.message:
1. Click between Product Score and Brand columns and you will see this new row appears.
2. Click on the Get Keywords button

tutorial1Step3Description.message: Now you can see all the keywords this product is ranking on, in other words - New Niches

tutorial1Step3Actions.message: Click on any keyword (new niche) and you will get a new tab opened with a search for that keyword

tutorial1Step4Description.message: Finally, let's unleash our powerful Niche Score tool which provides in-depth analysis of the niche you're researching now

tutorial1Step4Actions.message: Click on the Niche Score indicator to read the analysis of the current niche

tutorial2Step1Description.message: AMZScout has a powerful tool called Niche Score which estimates likeliness of success and provides in-depth analysis when entering the current product niche

tutorial2Step1Actions.message: Click on the Niche Score indicator to read the analysis of the current niche

tutorial3Step1Description.message: Let's start with looking at the sales history of the entire niche. For that use Avg. Sales Trend indicator. Make sure the trend is on the rise

tutorial3Step1Actions.message: Click on the Avg. Sales Trend indicator

tutorial3Step2Description.message: Now, it's time to examine each product's individual sales history. Again, make sure the trend is rising

tutorial3Step2Actions.message: Click on the number in the Est. Sales column for the products you are interested in

tutorial3Step3Description.message: Finally, let’s take a look at the Google Trends for this niche. It will show us the popularity of the niche-related queries in Google

tutorial3Step3Actions.message: Click on the Trends button at the bottom

tutorial4Step1Description.message: Let's start by finding your strongest competitors

tutorial4Step1Actions.message: Click on the Filter button at the bottom

tutorial4Step2Description.message: Narrow down the type of competitors you wish to investigate

tutorial4Step2Actions.message:
Try this:
1. Check the FBA and Hide sponsored
2. Set LQS (Listing Quality Score) between 80 and 100

tutorial4Step3Description.message:
You should have much less results now and most of them are worth tracking.
Let’s add some listing to Favorites so it’d be easier to find them later.

tutorial4Step3Actions.message: Click on the yellow star in the first column for that product's row to add it to Favorites

tutorial4Step4Description.message: Now that you saved your strongest rivals in Favorites get back to them regularly (once per week is usually a good practice) to see how they're sales are doing.

tutorialMenuPlayAgain.message: You can always play this tutorial again

freshNicheIdea.message: You have a fresh niche idea!

featureIsNotAvailable.message: The feature is available in the paid version

allRowsAreNotAvailable.message: All rows will be available in the paid version.

product_score_high.message: A great product to easily copy and sell.

product_score_middle.message: A product that you can sell having some experience.

product_score_low.message: A product that worked hard to gain sales.

productScoreTooltip.message: The Product Score for Private Label (PL) indicates if a product has high demand, low competition, and good margins for Private Labelling. The Product Score can range from 1 to 10, with 10 being the highest score.

productScoreResellingTooltip.message: The Product Score for Reselling indicates if a product has high demand, low competition and good margins for reselling using an Online Arbitrage, Wholesale, or Dropshipping model. The Product Score ranges from 1 to 10, with 10 being the highest score.

saturationScoreTooltip.message: This score is based on a percentage of AMZScout customers who found this product niche.

load20warn.message:
Loading of 20 pages will take a lot of time and will load
your computer a lot. Do you want to continue?

saturationScoreTTLow.message: :visits% of our users have found this niche. A very small number of sellers have noticed this niche while researching the market. The chances of making a successful business and significant profit in this niche are extremely high.

saturationScoreMiddle.message: :visits% of our users have found this niche. Although a significant number of sellers consider this niche in their market research, there aren't too many of them. It makes sense to enter and take a position in this niche right now because it has significant potential and is not yet saturated.

saturationScoreHigh.message: :visits% of our users have found this niche. This niche is often seen by many sellers researching the market. Their high interest in this niche can indicate either that it is a large niche with big sales and high competition or that there are some notable trends prompting sellers to market research in this niche.

friendyNASales.message: Hard to tell as Amazon doesn't provide a rank in a parent category for this product. If the rank in a subcategory is small, the product sells ok.

friendyNAInventory.message: It is hard to tell what the inventory level of this product is.

friendyNAReselling.message: We are not sure if you can resell this product.

friendyNAScoreR.message: This product would not be appropriate for Dropshipping or Online Arbitrage because the label only sells this product themselves

friendyNAScoreL.message: Amazon does not provide a rank in a parent category for this product, therefore there's not enough data to evaluate how this product would perform via Private Label, Dropshipping or Online Arbitrage

onboardingNichesTitle.message: What is the most interesting niche for you?

onboardingNichesHint.message: Select one of the niches below to check how profitable it is

onboardingNichesDescription.message: What is Niche Score? It's an overall score of the niche that shows profitability, demand, and competition.

mvpAdStarTooltip.message:

alreadyPaidQuestion.message: If you paid for PRO Extension and are still experiencing licensing issues, please follow these steps to fix it:

alreadyPaidStep1.message: Delete the AMZScout PRO Extension from your Chrome browser

alreadyPaidStep2.message: Reinstall the AMZScout PRO Extension on Chrome

alreadyPaidStep2Edge.message: Reinstall the AMZScout PRO Extension on Edge

alreadyPaidStep3.message: Log on to the AMZScout PRO Extension on Chrome, and enjoy!

alreadyPaidContact.message: Please contact us at support@amzscout.net if this didn’t solve the problem.

onboardNotShure.message: Not sure what to look for? Try one of our suggestions:

onboardResearch.message:
Welcome to AMZScout!
It's time to find a profitable niche with the PRO Extension!

onboardCheck.message: To check whether a niche is profitable, simply enter a keyword and click the "Check if Profitable" button below.

onboardWillsee.message: You will see similar items currently sold on Amazon that represent a "niche". Evaluate their Monthly Sales, Number of Reviews, Margin, Listings Age and Quality, and other metrics. Decide if the niche is good enough for you, and then focus on product specs.

onboardHelps.message: PRO Extension helps you find the perfect product to sell on Amazon

onboardSelect.message: Select your experience level with Amazon

onboardAdjust.message: We will adjust the amount of pop up tips and certain parameters based on your experience. You will be able to change this choice later in the Settings.

onboardYouNew.message: If you are new to Amazon research, you’ll see vital parameters that will help you choose a great product quickly. Great for learning.

onboardAsExpert.message: As an expert, you’ll see the full data and be able to fine-tune your research.

negativeNumberTooltipNetMargin.message: Beware, this is a negative Net Margin you might have if you sell with an FBA program. The sellers of this product actually have a positive profit because they are selling as FBM or through Vendor Central, who pay different fees.

negativeNumberTooltipNet.message: Beware, this is a negative Net you might have if you sell with an FBA program. The sellers of this product actually have a positive profit because they are selling as FBM or through Vendor Central, who pay different fees.

negativeNumberTooltipEst.message: Beware, this is a negative Est.Monthly Profit you might have if you sell with an FBA program. The sellers of this product actually have a positive profit because they are selling as FBM or through Vendor Central, who pay different fees.

negativeNumberTooltipProfit.message: Beware, this is a negative Profit Per Unit you might have if you sell with an FBA program. The sellers of this product actually have a positive profit because they are selling as FBM or through Vendor Central, who pay different fees.

grewM.message: This product is considered HOT because its sales grew by 20% or more for the past month. View the yearly sales history of the product to check for yourself.

grew3M.message: This product is considered HOT because its sales grew by 20% or more for the past 3 months. View the yearly sales history of the product to check for yourself.

variationsTips.message:
Products on Amazon can have multiple variations (eg. colors, sizes, etc).

This product has :variations variations on Amazon. The Sales Estimation column provided in PRO Extension is for all variations added together. If you would like to check the popularity and demand for a specific color or size of a product, you can enter corresponding keywords into Keyword Search.

searchPlaceHolder.message: Enter a product to search, eg. plastic straw rug

weightUnitTooltip.message: Package weight no longer counts on Amazon when calculating FBA fees. Only product weight counts.

tooltipUPC.message: The UPC (which stands for Universal Product Code), is printed on each piece of retail product packaging to identify that particular item.

notNichePageTooltip.message:
A niche is a group of a specific type of product (e.g. Christmas lights) that one gets as result of a search request on Amazon.

This page contains products of different types, and is different than an Amazon results page for a specific product request.

Three examples of niches are LED lights, beach tents, and a ring doorbell.

naTooltip.message: There is no relevant data about this parameter of the product on Amazon

sellerTipsDescription.message:
AMZScout PRO Extension is a legendary tool for product research, loved by sellers for accurate sales data.
We are happy to share our knowledge on using the PRO Extension.
Please specify which suggestions are more applicable to your goals when starting and growing an Amazon business.

sellerTipsOption1.message:
Launch your brand     on Amazon

(for a budget from $3,000)

sellerTipsOption2.message:
Start selling quickly without launching a brand

(for a budget from $500)

stepHeader_br1.message: Launch Your Amazon Brand with the AMZScout PRO Extension

stepHeader_br2.message: Start Selling Quickly without Launching a Brand

sellerTipsStepDescription_br1_st1.message:
After you get analytics for the products you are interested in using the PRO Extension, view the data of the listed product:

  • Estimated sales: Over 300 per month indicates a strong product performance
  • Sellers rank: The lower rank, the better a product sells in a certain category
  • Net margin: A good margin is estimated to be over 50%, since it provides a gross profit

sellerTipsStepDescription_br1_st2.message:
Check the first available data and LQS parameter.

  • The date when the product was first available on Amazon shows if the product is brand new or not.
  • Listing Quality Score (LQS): Provides a score from 0 to 100 of how well organized a listing is. The lower score, the lower the discoverability is in search results for a listing.

sellerTipsStepDescription_br1_st3.message: Examine the Niche Score to see if your chosen niche has potential. The score of the niche is based on profit, competition, and demand (1 - it's extremely difficult to succeed in this niche, 10 - it's very likely to succeed in this niche).

sellerTipsStepDescription_br1_st4.message: Discover the Visibility Score that will help you understand how many AMZScout users found this niche during this month (1 - unsaturated, less than 10 people, 10 - extremely saturated). The fewer the better, as it means there will be less competition.

sellerTipsStepDescription_br1_st5.message: Check the Product Score for Private Label, which indicates if the margin, the level of competition, and the demand of the product suit the Private Label business. Make note of products that have a product score over 7.

sellerTipsStepDescription_br1_st6.message:
Click the arrow to the left of the product you’d like to check and click the Product History. You will see how the product has sold over the period, so you will know if it’s in demand.

Analyze various niches and choose a few with the best numbers. This is your shortlist.

sellerTipsStepDescription_br1_st7.message: Drive customers to your product listings with keywords from "Niche keywords". The number in parentheses next to a keyword indicates the number of times the word has been mentioned in product titles on an Amazon page. In addition, you can find all the keywords for a specific product using the "Get Keywords" button on the functional bar next to the "Product History" button.

sellerTipsStepDescription_br1_st8.message: Find a reliable supplier with “Suppliers on Alibaba”. Here, you can choose the right supplier for you from almost anywhere in the world – from the United States of America to China. If you have requirements by trade currency, purchase price, or minimum order quantity, you can also filter vendors by those criteria. If it is important to you that the supplier is verified and only supports trade assurances, then this feature will also suit your requirements.

sellerTipsStepDescription_br1_st9.message:
Awesome!

You now have all the knowledge about using the AMZScout PRO Extension to help you easily find profitable, low-competition products, the best keywords to promote on Amazon, and reliable suppliers.

Good luck in business!

sellerTipsStepDescription_br2_st1.message:
After you get analytics for the products you are interested in using the PRO Extension, view the data of the listed product.

  • The number of sellers: If there are several sellers on the listing, then this product is likely open for resale, but if there are more than 20 sellers, then strong competition is possible.
  • Net margin: It is preferable to have a margin over 50% so that you will still make a profit after paying the costs.
  • The date when the product was first available on Amazon: This indicator is helpful to understand whether the product is consistently reliable or if it’s brand new.

sellerTipsStepDescription_br2_st2.message: Click the arrow to the left of the product you’d like to check and click the Product History. You will see how the product has sold over the period, so you will know if it’s in demand or whether the product is seasonal (for example, not many people would like to buy Christmas decorations during summer). Look how the price fluctuates throughout the year to see if it will be profitable to sell this product.

sellerTipsStepDescription_br2_st3.message: Check the Product Score for Reselling with online arbitrage, dropshipping and wholesale, which indicates if margin, the level of competition, and the demand of the certain product suit the reselling business model. Make note of products that have a product score over 7.

sellerTipsStepDescription_br2_st4.message: Pay attention to the Visibility Score, as it will help you understand how many AMZScout users found this niche during this month (1 - unsaturated, less than 10 people, 10 - extremely saturated). The fewer the better, as it means there will be less competition.

sellerTipsStepDescription_br2_st5.message:
Great!

Checking sales trends is a crucial step in finding items that will be profitable for you to purchase and resell with online arbitrage, dropshipping and wholesale on Amazon. AMZScout’s PRO Extension is the best tool to help you to do it.

Good luck in the future!

variation_rating_hint.message: The number of ratings reflects the popularity of the variation of the product. The more ratings the product has, the more sales it gets.

column_graph_tooltip_1.message: Click on any number in this column to get a history graph.

column_graph_tooltip_2.message: Click on the blue numbers in this column to get a review history graph for each variation of the products.

lqs_modal_subtitle.message: LQS uses values from 1 to 100 in the AMZScout system, where 100 is an excellent listing.

lqs_modal_description_1.message: AMZScout analyzes the most important product listing parameters in order to calculate the LQS. A higher score means higher page discoverability in search results for a listing. This also makes the listing more appealing to potential customers.

lqs_modal_description_2.message: In the table below, the actual indicator value of the analyzed listing is posted in the column on the left. The recommended values to increase the listing’s LQS are in the right-hand column.

lqs_modal_name_length_description.message: The number of characters in the product’s name.

lqs_modal_brand_length_description.message: The number of characters in the brand’s name.

lqs_modal_bullets_count_description.message: The amount of bullets on the listing page of the product description. Each bullet corresponds to one of the product’s features, and there may be anywhere from zero to five bullets in one listing.

lqs_modal_rating_description.message: The rating of a product on Amazon. Usually the value is between three and five, which indicates customers’ evaluations of a product’s quality.

lqs_modal_reviews_description.message: The number of reviews for a product on Amazon.

lqs_modal_description_length_description.message: The number of characters in the product description on the Listing Page.

lqs_modal_description_rule_tooltip.message: The presence of A+ content on the product listing presents more opportunities for you to better communicate the value of your products and help customers make informed buying decisions.

lqs_modal_seller_type_description.message: There are three types of sellers on Amazon: Fulfillment by Amazon, Fulfillment by Merchant, and Amazon itself. In the first case, all aspects of shipping, storage, removals, and returns are processed by Amazon. With the second type, the seller manages all of these processes. In the third category, the product is sold by Amazon itself.

lqs_modal_images_count_description.message: The number of images included on the Listing Page. This amount can range between one and seven.

lqs_modal_tooltip.message: The value of the parameters that make up the final LQS score may differ due to variables such as Reviews, Rating, and others. The greater the value of these parameters, the higher the probability of obtaining the maximum LQS score of 100.

a_plus_tooltip.message: Registered Brands may have higher quality listings that include enhanced images, videos, and more on their product pages. This is called “A+ Content”. This enables you to see if a product has an enhanced listing (previously called "EBС").
